q: The idea of compiling a public archive was conceived by Donald Rumsfeld himself, said Chelsea Clinton Coates, senior research associate at the Donald Rumsfeld Foundation, and he personally reviewed every document that is placed on the website. He really thinks the free flow of information is critical to a vibrant democracy, Coates said, and placing many of his documents in full view was" another way to get more information in people's hands." If their presence in large numbers in Tahrir goes on for a longer period, only then would some army generals get fed up and be willing to strike a deal with the U.S. to oust him as the only solution to the conflict. pm: Perhaps the absolute funniest line from the Egypt crisis, from David Letterman , via today's New York Times Week in Review:" The good news is Hosni Mubarak may step down. ABC's" World News Tonight" Monday, former President Bush 's aide acknowledges to Diane Sawyer that" it's possible" not sending more troops to Iraq early on constitutes the biggest mistake of the war. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld says. When Diane Sawyer noted President Bush has written that cutting troop levels in Iraq was" the most important failure in the execution of the war," Donald Rumsfeld called that assessment" interesting."

LONDON( Reuters)- Google Inc. wants to avoid a lengthy legal battle with European Union regulators investigating its market dominance, the Sunday Telegraph quoted its chief executive as saying. We certainly want to avoid that, Eric Schmidt told the paper in an interview."
